paper_abstract: Many studies have shown that association-based classification can achieve higher accuracy than traditional rule based schemes. However, when applied to text classification domain, the high dimensionality, the diversity of text data sets and the class skew make classification tasks more complicated. In this study, we present a new method for associative text categorization tasks. First,we integrate the feature selection into rule pruning process rather than a separate preprocess procedure. Second, we combine several techniques to efficiently extract rules. Third, a new score model is used to handle the problem caused by imbalanced class distribution. A series of experiments on various real text corpora indicate that by applying our approaches, associative text classification (ATC) can achieve as competitive classification performance as well-known support vector machines (SVM) do.
paper_title: Feature selection, rule extraction, and score model: Making ATC competitive with SVM
